info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 01 at 1:06AM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN WABASH...SOUTHEASTERN EDWARDS AND SOUTHWESTERN GIBSON COUNTIES... At 105 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles northeast of Grayville, or 8 miles southwest of Mount Carmel, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. This severe storm will be near... Mount Carmel around 120 AM CDT. Owensville around 135 AM CDT. Princeton around 145 AM CDT. Fort Branch around 150 AM CDT. Haubstadt around 155 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Keensburg, Bellmont and Browns. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
